title: How to Solve Simultaneous Equations Using Elimination Method

steps.title: Write down both of the equations that you'll need to solve.
steps.content: Write down both of the equations that you'll need to solve. [1] X Research source 3x - y = 12 2x + y = 13

steps.title: Number the equations.
steps.content: Number the equations. 3x - y = 12 as number one, and 2x + y = 13 as number two. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check if both equations have the same variable/unknown term in them.
steps.content: Check if both equations have the same variable/unknown term in them. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Look for signs of the unknown variables or terms.
steps.content: Look for signs of the unknown variables or terms. Remember subtraction can also be referred to as the addition of a negative number. If the signs are the same, subtract both equations. If they are different then add the equations. [4] X Research source 3x - y = 12 + 2x + y = 13 ------------- 5x = 25

steps.title: Solve to find the first unknown variable from the resulting (rather shortened) equation.
steps.content: Solve to find the first unknown variable from the resulting (rather shortened) equation. Divide both sides by the coefficient of the left side. Take 5 to the other side.It will look like this:x = 25/5. [5] X Research source

steps.title: 25 divided by 5 makes 5 so we have now found the value of "x" which is 5.
steps.content: 25 divided by 5 makes 5 so we have now found the value of "x" which is 5.

steps.title: Find the value of "y".
steps.content: Find the value of "y". Use the value of x that was obtained above into either equation (but stick with this equation for the time being). Substitute this value of x into the equation. [6] X Research source 3x - y = 12 3(5)-y = 12 15 - y = 12 - y = 12 - 15 - y = - 3(divide both sides by negative one, will be able to cut both signs) y = 3

steps.title: Check the problem.
steps.content: Check the problem. Substitute both the values into the other equation. If the two side numbers at the very end equal each other, you've correctly solved this system of simultaneous equations. [7] X Research source 3x - y = 12 3(5) - 3 = 12 15 - 3 = 12 12 = 12
